CLUE: Sesame Street character -- patron saint of sailors
FOUND IN: Elmo - Through his various roles as a caring character on Sesame Street, Elmo could symbolize an emotional support system for young sailors navigating their first voyages at sea.
Gertrude: Ophelia's mother, who marries Claudius after her husband's death in Shakespeare's play "Hamlet"
Backup (in terms of support and assistance)

It was used predominantly from the early colonial era until it gained independence in 1948 when its official English name changed to "Sri Lanka." The term 'Ceylon' is deeply rooted in the country's history and carries historical significance, being derived from an earlier version of the Sinhalese word "seylanna" which means "copper-plate island," referring to a plate made out of copper.
